body: On almost every website I have encountered, conservatives are described as supporting economic freedom but restrictions on personal freedom, and liberals as favoring economic restrictions but supporting personal freedoms. I don't think either definition is correct, but the most astounding one to me is the idea that liberals believe in personal freedom. I don't know about you, but I don't think banning free speech, banning guns, compelling special treatment of certain groups, having insane amounts of laws, banning certain religions and beliefs, and a totalitarian government sound much like personal freedom. This also leads to libertarians being described as economically conservative and socially liberal, which makes no sense and is actually descriptive of neoliberals instead. Anyone know what led to this classification?

post.title: Why are liberals considered to be for personal freedom?

body:
This came about because of a major switch in language.  The term liberal has in its root liberty, and was originally intended as such.  Over time, it became associated with the democrat party as opposed to the values of liberty, which led to the two terms (democrat and liberal) being interchangeable.  The term libertarian evolved to mean those for individual liberty instead, which is still a little different than it was originally used, but far closer.  Thus we see the corruption of language that has become common.

It is also worth noting that the terms "left" and "right" in American politics are much different than used elsewhere in the world.  This has not only led to confusion, but to another pressure from the American left to reclassify themselves as moderate or centrists so to juxtapose their position with the American right.

body:
The left won the culture war and then became complete hypocrites. Guilty until proven innocent? That used to be something liberals would lecture conservatives about. Then came MeToo. Making assumptions based on race or class? Mind your own business and don't worry about what others think or believe? Freedom of speech even if you completely vehemently disagree with your opponent?

All gone, and with a quickness I never would have expected. At this point we need to completely burn down and rebuild most of our media and education systems to get back to what we had. My greatest fear is actually that Trump wins but doesn't do enough to reign these people in. Without that effort we will just lose everything in 2024 or 2028. Whenever they get complete control this time, all the lights will go out.
